TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The wound assessment and treatment domain is the major development of the standard, the design of this domain supports the use of assessment frameworks such as SINBAD, TIME etc. There are some notable differences between the three wound types, these are identified here by wound type specific data concepts

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Details of any risks related to the person.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is a risks record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The start date of the risk.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The date the risk ended.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The risk to the person or others, this includes any risk the person might cause to themselves or to others. e.g. suicide, self harm.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for risk.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - <281694009 |Finding of at risk (finding)|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Additional details about the risk.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Top level concept that contains the wound specific concepts covering baseline information, treatment, assessment observation

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Initial description, mapping and number of wounds that exist at the start of the wound care episode

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Wounds should be classified by the dominant cause of wounding and/ or non-healing e.g. diabetic foot ulcer, venous leg ulcer, pressure ulcer etc, Surgical wounds should be classified by the amount of contamination which could lead to delayed wound healing and infection: Clean, Clean-Contaminated, Contaminated, Dirty <225552003 |Wound finding (finding)|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for the wound classification

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - <225552003 |Wound finding (finding)|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A summary of the problems that require investigation or treatment.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is a problem list record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under problem list. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A condition which needs addressing and so is important for every professional to know about when seeing the person. Problems may include diagnoses, symptoms, and social or behavioural issues

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for the problem list.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A date or estimated date that the problem began

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The date or estimated date the problem was resolved.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The body site relevant to the problem.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for body site.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT.

TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT.

TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT.

TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The problem priority level. This can be either significant or minor.

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: To be used to calculate wound duration

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This group includes data concepts that are specific to surgical wounds management

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Certain surgeries by definition are contaminated/ dirty and therefore more at risk of surgical wound complications

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value of the type of surgery

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT <387713003 |Surgical procedure (procedure)

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: What type of Surgery was it, Emergency surgery means that the patient has not had a preoperative risk assessment and is not optimised. Often emergency surgery is contaminated/dirty

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Coded value for emergency / elective surgery

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT << 387713003 |Surgical procedure (procedure)| : << 260870009 |Priority (attribute)| = 25876001 |Emergency (qualifier value)| OR << 260870009 |Priority (attribute)| = << 103390000 |Elective (qualifier value)|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: How many wounds were created during the surgery, for example there could be a wound for graft site as well as where the donor graft was taken from

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The date that the surgery took place

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Surgery of >2 hours increase the risk of surgical wound complications

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Duration in hours and mins hh:mm

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The method that was used to close the wound(s)

TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The name of the document. This should align to the PRSB document naming standard. Where the document is a KOS document this field (designated typeCode) is used to carry the DICOM Imaging procedure: This attribute shall be populated by the XDS-I Imaging Document Source from a code in the Procedure Code Sequence (0008,1032) of the performed procedure with which the document is associated. Values may be found in a suitable DICOM browser

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - As per the https://theprsb.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Clinical-document-indexing-standards_NHS-Scotland.pdf

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The ankle-brachial pressure index ( ABPI ) or ankle-brachial index ( ABI ) is the ratio of the blood pressure at the ankle to the blood pressure in the upper arm (brachium). Compared to the arm, lower blood pressure in the leg suggests blocked arteries due to peripheral artery disease (PAD). The ABPI is calculated by dividing the systolic blood pressure at the ankle by the systolic blood pressure in the arm. [1] Less than 0.5 suggests severe arterial disease. Compression treatment is contraindicated. Refer the person urgently for specialist vascular assessment. Greater than 0.5 to less than 0.8 suggests the presence of arterial disease or mixed arterial/venous disease. Compression should generally be avoided. However, reduced compression can be used under specialist advice and with strict supervision. Refer the person for specialist vascular assessment. Between 0.8 and 1.3 suggests no evidence of significant arterial disease. Compression may be safely applied in most people. For peo...

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Ratio of blood pressure at ankle : blood pressure in upper arm

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Commonly used in patients with diabetes and peripheral arterial disease, a toe brachial pressure index (TBPI) is a noninvasive way of determining arterial perfusion in feet and toes . A Doppler device and a sphygmomanometer are used to measure systolic pressure in the arm and the great toe.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: ratio between the systolic blood pressure in the right or left toe and the higher of the systolic pressure in the right or left arms .

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Formal grading of pressure ulcers

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Is crepitus present crepitus describes a popping, clicking or crackling sound in a joint . Joint popping sounds – what some may call bone cracking – may mean that air is moving in the joint, which is usually harmless.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Is there a healing ridge A healing ridge of thickened tissue indicating newly formed collagen can be felt about 1cm either side of the incision along its length, and persists into the remodelling phase

TaggedValue.value: Yes / No indicating the presence of a healing ridge

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Information and advice given.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The oral, written, or multi-media information or advice given to the person, carer, other authorised representative, care professional or other third party. May include advice about actions related to medicines or other ongoing care activities on an ‘information prescription'. State here if there are concerns about the extent to which the person and/or carer understand the information provided about diagnosis, prognosis and treatment.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for information and advice given.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT.

TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The details of planned investigations, procedures and treatment, and whether this plan has been agreed with the person or their legitimate representative.

Model.name: Plan and requested actions record entry

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is a plan and requested actions record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Including planned investigations, procedures and treatment for a person's identified conditions and priorities. For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including the person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location, strategies.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location, strategies.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Indicates whether the person or their legitimate representative has agreed the entire plan or individual aspects of treatment, expected outcomes, risks and alternative treatments. A record of the agreement of the decisions made.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is the future appointments record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Summary of the episode or period of care. Where possible, very brief. This may include interpretation of findings and results; differential diagnoses, opinion and specific action(s). Planned actions should be recorded under plan and requested actions or in the personalised care and support plan.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text
